intro: Kumara disticha, commonly known as the two-leaved kumara, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive two leaves that emerge from the stem. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by pods containing edible seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and historical significance, it is considered a culturally important species in Māori tradition.
